Class Reflection

java.lang.Object
education.the_software_toolsmith.testing.framework.Reflection
public class Reflection extends Object
Utilities to access and test characteristics of reference types, methods, fields.
Version:
1.0 2020-08-08 Initial implementation - extracted from DMRJUnitTestsBase.java, 1.1 2020-09-13 enhance invoke() to check both defined and generic parameter types when searching for a matching method, 1.2 2020-10-19 add circular array retrieval, 1.3 2021-04-11 repackage as canned utility testing suite, 1.4 2021-04-18
  • add instantiate() methods
  • add invoke() convenience method
  • enhance error reporting in invoke() and instantiate() to include parameter types
, 1.4.1 2021-06-19 reflect move of other classes from ...testing.junit package to ...testing package, 1.5 2025-03-17 track method renaming in TestData.java, 1.6 2025-03-18 enhance getContentsOfChainBackedCollection() to anticipate ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException and report a more meaningful state exception, 1.7 2025-06-14
  • enhance/fix isCollection() to check Collection and Map
  • add isBridge()
  • move ArrayDimensions() and arrayOf() here from TestClassDMRTests
  • add getChainAsArray() and getChainAsList()
  • deprecate getContentsOfChainBackedCollection()
, 1.7.1 2025-07-18 swap operands to '==' and '!=' when comparing against a constant so the constant is the left operand, 2.0 2025-07-19 move all other specialized functionality to separate classes
Author:
Dave Rosenberg

  • Method Details

    • arrayDimensions

      public static int arrayDimensions(Field field)
      Determine the number of dimensions of an array
      Parameters:
      field - the field to test
      Returns:
      the field's number of dimensions

      note: if field isn't an array, the number of dimensions is 0

      Since:
      1.7

    • arrayOf

      public static Class<?> arrayOf(Field field)
      Determine the type of the components of an array
      Parameters:
      field - the field to test
      Returns:
      the field's component type

      note: if field isn't an array, field's type is returned

      Since:
      1.7

      Parameters:
      field - the field to test
      Returns:
      true if field is of an annotation type; false otherwise
